what: Automated Tasks and Point Farmer for Dr Frost Maths
title: Automated Tasks and Point Farmer for Dr Frost Maths
text: tidydrfrost allows automate complete Dr Frost Maths tasks using R. allows points mastery quickly easily gained.

title: Automated Tasks and Point Farmer for Dr Frost Maths
text: can install development version tidydrfrost GitHub :

title: Automated Tasks and Point Farmer for Dr Frost Maths
text: Interacting Dr Frost Maths simple. package revolves around single function: function perform tasks implemented. task awards certain number points. Alternatively, can specify tasks complete: controlled approach specifying tasks, use dr_frost_tasks() function. Currently following tasks implemented:
code: library(tidydrfrost) perform_tasks() perform_tasks(c("addition_subtraction", "multiplication")) tasks <- dr_frost_tasks(exclude = "division") perform_tasks(tasks) print(dr_frost_tasks(), n = Inf)

title: Automated Tasks and Point Farmer for Dr Frost Maths
text: perform_tasks() function work, need specify Dr Frost Maths account. don’t want specify time use function, use dr_frost_account() function. uses keyring backend, allowing credentials securely stored sessions. stored account, perform_tasks() function can called without specify email password.

what: Store your account details securely — dr_frost_account
title: Store your account details securely — dr_frost_account
text: Securely store email password Dr Frost Maths account can used sessions. keyring::keyring-package package used backend, meaning credentials stored securely permanently.

title: Store your account details securely — dr_frost_account
Store your account details securely — dr_frost_account
text: email email Dr Frost Account. Multiple accounts different emails can stored. keyring string, passed keyring::key_set() keyring::key_get(). Use store Dr Frost credentials custom keyring.

title: Store your account details securely — dr_frost_account
text: Nothing. function called side effects.

title: Store your account details securely — dr_frost_account
text: Calling function open prompt, allowing enter password securely. change password stored specific email, just call function email. account store first stored specified keyring, account marked 'default' keyring. means perform_tasks() called without specifying email, account used default. Change set_default_account(). means stored account, perform_tasks() function can called without specifying email password.

title: Store your account details securely — dr_frost_account

what: Get the set of available tasks — dr_frost_tasks
title: Get the set of available tasks — dr_frost_tasks
text: Retrieve set tasks can completed Dr Frost Maths, choosing tasks include exclude.

title: Get the set of available tasks — dr_frost_tasks
Get the set of available tasks — dr_frost_tasks
text: include character vector tasks include. NULL, tasks included. exclude character vector tasks exclude. NULL, tasks excluded. x dr_frost_tasks object. ... used.

title: Get the set of available tasks — dr_frost_tasks
text: data frame additional class 'dr_frost_tasks', row describes task. table 4 variables: topic topic task falls . subtopic subtopic task. task_name name task. description brief description task.

title: Get the set of available tasks — dr_frost_tasks
text: include argument matches topic, subtopic task name task, tasks require direct match string included. Otherwise, partial matching/pattern recognition used identify matches. applies exclude argument. makes specifying tasks simple time, can sometimes lead unexpected cases complex searches result less matches.

title: Get the set of available tasks — dr_frost_tasks
code: dr_frost_tasks() #> # 10 Dr Frost tasks #>  #> ── KS2 Number ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Arithmetic Operations ── #> • addition_subtraction #>   Add and subtract whole numbers. #> • multiplication #>   Multiply numbers up to 3 digit by 3 digit. #> • pictoral_division #>   Solve one step multiplication and division problems by using pictorial #>   representations and arrays. #> • division #>   Divide numbers. #> • number_facts #>   Using number facts to solve connected calculations. #> • missing_digits #>   Solve multiplication, addition and subtraction problems involving missing #>   digits. #> • bidmas #>   Understand the order in which operators in an expression are evaluated #>   according to BIDMAS. #> • estimate_calculations #>   Estimate the result of a calculation by first rounding each number. #>  #> ── Times tables ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> • fixed_time #>   You have 30 seconds to answer as many questions as you can on all #>   times/divide tables. Can you get on the leaderboard? #> • individual_practice #>   Practise each times table/divide table separately, with points for accuracy #>   and speed.  dr_frost_tasks(include = "addition_subtraction") #> # 1 Dr Frost task #>  #> ── KS2 Number ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Arithmetic Operations ── #> • addition_subtraction #>   Add and subtract whole numbers.  dr_frost_tasks(include = "Arithmetic Operations") #> # 8 Dr Frost tasks #>  #> ── KS2 Number ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Arithmetic Operations ── #> • addition_subtraction #>   Add and subtract whole numbers. #> • multiplication #>   Multiply numbers up to 3 digit by 3 digit. #> • pictoral_division #>   Solve one step multiplication and division problems by using pictorial #>   representations and arrays. #> • division #>   Divide numbers. #> • number_facts #>   Using number facts to solve connected calculations. #> • missing_digits #>   Solve multiplication, addition and subtraction problems involving missing #>   digits. #> • bidmas #>   Understand the order in which operators in an expression are evaluated #>   according to BIDMAS. #> • estimate_calculations #>   Estimate the result of a calculation by first rounding each number.  dr_frost_tasks(include = "KS3 Number") #> # 0 Dr Frost tasks  dr_frost_tasks(include = "KS3", exclude = "Arithmetic") #> # 0 Dr Frost tasks  dr_frost_tasks(exclude = "addition") #> # 8 Dr Frost tasks #>  #> ── KS2 Number ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Arithmetic Operations ── #> • multiplication #>   Multiply numbers up to 3 digit by 3 digit. #> • pictoral_division #>   Solve one step multiplication and division problems by using pictorial #>   representations and arrays. #> • division #>   Divide numbers. #> • number_facts #>   Using number facts to solve connected calculations. #> • bidmas #>   Understand the order in which operators in an expression are evaluated #>   according to BIDMAS. #> • estimate_calculations #>   Estimate the result of a calculation by first rounding each number. #>  #> ── Times tables ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> • fixed_time #>   You have 30 seconds to answer as many questions as you can on all #>   times/divide tables. Can you get on the leaderboard? #> • individual_practice #>   Practise each times table/divide table separately, with points for accuracy #>   and speed.  tibble::as_tibble(dr_frost_tasks()) #> # A tibble: 10 × 4 #>    topic        subtopic                task_name             description        #>    <chr>        <chr>                   <chr>                 <chr>              #>  1 KS2 Number   "Arithmetic Operations" addition_subtraction  "Add and subtract… #>  2 KS2 Number   "Arithmetic Operations" multiplication        "Multiply numbers… #>  3 KS2 Number   "Arithmetic Operations" pictoral_division     "Solve one step m… #>  4 KS2 Number   "Arithmetic Operations" division              "Divide numbers."  #>  5 KS2 Number   "Arithmetic Operations" number_facts          " Using number fa… #>  6 KS2 Number   "Arithmetic Operations" missing_digits        "Solve multiplica… #>  7 KS2 Number   "Arithmetic Operations" bidmas                "Understand the o… #>  8 KS2 Number   "Arithmetic Operations" estimate_calculations "Estimate the res… #>  9 Times tables ""                      fixed_time            "You have 30 seco… #> 10 Times tables ""                      individual_practice   "Practise each ti…

what: Complete Dr Frost Maths tasks — perform_tasks
title: Complete Dr Frost Maths tasks — perform_tasks
text: Complete set Dr Frost Maths tasks. task rewards user certain number points, can vary.

title: Complete Dr Frost Maths tasks — perform_tasks
code: perform_tasks(   tasks = dr_frost_tasks(),   email = NULL,   password = NULL,   keyring = NULL,   end = TRUE )

title: Complete Dr Frost Maths tasks — perform_tasks
text: tasks tasks complete. Either dr_frost_tasks() object, character vector. character vector supplied, passed include argument dr_frost_tasks() function. default, available tasks completed. email Used login website. NULL, default email used. password Used login website. NULL, function try find password corresponding email set using dr_frost_account(). keyring string, passed keyring::key_get(). Use Dr Frost credentials stored keyring default. end Whether browser session closed tasks completed.

title: Complete Dr Frost Maths tasks — perform_tasks
text: data frame information task, 4 variables: task task attempted. completed Whether task successfully completed. points number points earned completing task. error task failed, error object returned.

title: Complete Dr Frost Maths tasks — perform_tasks
text: Completing Dr Frost Tasks requires continuous (although necessarily fast) internet connection, tasks fail connection found extended period time. Completing task calls corresponding function Python.

title: Complete Dr Frost Maths tasks — perform_tasks
Printing Dr Frost tasks — print.dr_frost_tasks
text: dr_frost_tasks object enhanced printing method, using topics subtopics headers.

title: Printing Dr Frost tasks — print.dr_frost_tasks
code: # S3 method for dr_frost_tasks print(x, ..., n = 10)

title: Printing Dr Frost tasks — print.dr_frost_tasks
text: x dr_frost_tasks object. ... used. n maximum number tasks show. Excess tasks truncated. Use Inf show tasks.

title: Printing Dr Frost tasks — print.dr_frost_tasks
text: x, invisibly

title: Printing Dr Frost tasks — print.dr_frost_tasks
text: printing method heavily inspired tibble printing method: tibble::print.tbl_df.

title: Printing Dr Frost tasks — print.dr_frost_tasks
code: print(dr_frost_tasks()) #> # 10 Dr Frost tasks #>  #> ── KS2 Number ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Arithmetic Operations ── #> • addition_subtraction #>   Add and subtract whole numbers. #> • multiplication #>   Multiply numbers up to 3 digit by 3 digit. #> • pictoral_division #>   Solve one step multiplication and division problems by using pictorial #>   representations and arrays. #> • division #>   Divide numbers. #> • number_facts #>   Using number facts to solve connected calculations. #> • missing_digits #>   Solve multiplication, addition and subtraction problems involving missing #>   digits. #> • bidmas #>   Understand the order in which operators in an expression are evaluated #>   according to BIDMAS. #> • estimate_calculations #>   Estimate the result of a calculation by first rounding each number. #>  #> ── Times tables ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> • fixed_time #>   You have 30 seconds to answer as many questions as you can on all #>   times/divide tables. Can you get on the leaderboard? #> • individual_practice #>   Practise each times table/divide table separately, with points for accuracy #>   and speed. print(dr_frost_tasks(), n = 5) #> # 5 Dr Frost tasks #>  #> ── KS2 Number ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Arithmetic Operations ── #> • addition_subtraction #>   Add and subtract whole numbers. #> • multiplication #>   Multiply numbers up to 3 digit by 3 digit. #> • pictoral_division #>   Solve one step multiplication and division problems by using pictorial #>   representations and arrays. #> • division #>   Divide numbers. #> • number_facts #>   Using number facts to solve connected calculations. #> … with 5 more tasks #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more tasks

what: tidydrfrost: Automated Tasks and Point Farmer for Dr Frost Maths — tidydrfrost-package
title: tidydrfrost: Automated Tasks and Point Farmer for Dr Frost Maths — tidydrfrost-package
text: Automates set tasks Dr Frost Maths (https://www.drfrostmaths.com/). Provides robust secure login method detailed Command Line Interface make completing tasks easy robust.
